page.title: 14Farming - Grass Management
page.content: Each year we re-seed between 6 and 8 acres of our grassland in order to maintain a good sward for grazing, haymaking and silage. In late Spring the fields which have been left ungrazed contain matured grass which is cut, dried, baled and put into store for use as Winter feed. These fields are then given a spreading of nitrogen based fertiliser and later sprayed with weedkiller in order to produce a second crop of grass which this time is cut and made into silage whilst it still contains a high water content. It is at this time that we need extra help on the farm and two of the{sons of our neighbouring farmer}at {Gayles Hall, Andrew and Kevin Stanwix, come to our aid. The grass is cut and chopped by a forage harvester and delivered to the silage clamp by trailer. This forms Winter feed too.
